labels.analysis: The Asset Price MCP Server is designed to retrieve and display real-time asset price information for various assets, including precious metals and cryptocurrencies. Its core functionality revolves around providing up-to-date financial data, which can be integrated into applications or used by large language models. The sole available tool, "get_asset_price," indicates that the server's primary purpose is to fetch current market prices efficiently.
labels.reasoning: The primary label of "Financial Services" was chosen as it directly aligns with the server's purpose of providing real-time asset pricing data. The secondary label of "Cryptocurrency & Blockchain" is included because the server explicitly mentions cryptocurrencies as part of its supported asset types. The server doesn't appear to have unique functionality that warrants a custom label, as its purpose is well-covered by predefined categories.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.author: @mk965/asset-price-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Retrieve and display real-time asset price information effortlessly. Access current prices for various assets, including precious metals and cryptocurrencies, to enhance your applications. Simplify data retrieval for large language models with this dedicated service.

tools.name: get_asset_price
tools.description: Deploy Server Asset Price MCP @mk965/asset-price-mcp Try in Playground get_asset_price

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@mk965/asset-price-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
